ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
- better skills in instrumental composition, DAWs
- motivation to write more music
Mostly just honing my own composition craft in my own style. It was also cool getting to see the wide variety of things that composing can mean from the guest speakers and fellow students.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I loved the freedom this class provides, and the opportunity to receive weekly lessons is amazing.

I wish more class time had been spent getting to know each other and our music. Sure, we got to hear each others presentations at the end of the semester, but it would have been cool to receive feedback during the semester as well and be exposed to each others work earlier. Some collaborative assignments also would not have been missed.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This is a great opportunity to get a lot of feedback on your compositions, and experiment with new styles and challenge yourself! It is up to you what you make of this course-- I would recommend going outside of your comfort zone and taking advantage of your weekly lessons by always having a good amount of new content to go over!

Yes, but with some hesitations. You can look at it in two ways.

On the one hand, I got to get credit for composing and get free weekly private lessons, and get to hear some of the leading composers of today talk about their music. Both of these are incredible opportunities and its a privilege to have them! There really isnt much work other than your main piece. And it is very accepting of different styles, classical and otherwise! You wont be forced to write a kind of music you dont like. So it feels like you may as well take the class if you already enjoy composing.

At the same time, the class is very, very unstructured. The course description made me think there would be smaller assignments that might target some specific skill, but basically the only assignment in the class was to work on your main piece. At times I felt like I could have gotten more specific feedback in my lessons. Often the Thursday class felt long and not the most engaging. And while I love the diversity of students preferred genres, it sometimes feels wrong to try to force people only interested in music production to learn about classical music and vice versa; because of this I often felt like I had no clue what was being discussed because I lacked the basic background knowledge. And dont expect this class to force you out of your comfort zoneyou have to motivate yourself.

So yes, but dont expect it to be much more than self-directed composition lessons.
